alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Gusty winds from an outflow boundary will impact portions of central Sussex County through 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary over Stony Creek, or 14 miles northeast of Purdy, moving east northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sussex, Stony Creek, Yale, Lumberton, Booker and Littleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
